page.title: 16Animals on the Farm
page.content: SHEEP On our farm we have Cheviot and Hamp shire Down sheep.The mother sheep are called ewes.The father sheep are called rams or tups.Sheep are dipped once a year to prevent illness.In summer the sheep are sheared. The sheep have lambs in early Spring.The man who looks after the sheep is called a shepherd.He carries a kind of stick shaped with a hook at one end, it is called a crook.The shepherd uses his crook to catch the sheep and the lambs.The shepherd uses dogs to help him,they work to whistles.Sheep live in sheds in the winter and the fields in the summer. CATTLE There are lots of kinds of cattle,Here ford,Charlais,Jersey are some of them. Our cattle give us beef and milk.Some cows have horns.They sleep in barns.
